details.purpose: Use to capture and report Oxford Hip Questionnaire (OHS) score details.
details.use:
Use to capture and report Oxford Hip Questionnaire score.
While openEHR archetypes are all freely available under an open license, the specific content of this archetype may be copyright protected. Any use of this archetype within implementations must be in compliance with the terms established by the copyright owners where a copyright exists.
details.misuse: Not to be used unless the terms of copyright have been observed (if a copyright exists).
details.copyright: Â© Clinical Models UK, Apperta Foundation

items.items: A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with HL7 or CDISC equivalents.
Patient-reported extent of usual pain in hip during past 4 weeks.

Questionnaire wording:
How would you describe the pain you usually had from your hip?
The patient has experienced moderate pain in hip during past 4 weeks.
The patient has experienced mild pain in hip during past 4 weeks.
The patient has experienced very mild pain in hip during past 4 weeks.
The patient has experienced no pain in hip during past 4 weeks.
Patient-reported trouble washing and drying because of hip pain.

Questionnaire wording:
Have you had any trouble with washing and drying yourself (all over) because of your hip?
The patient has trouble all the time washing and drying in the last 4 weeks because of pain in the hip.
The patient has no trouble washing and drying in the last 4 weeks because of pain in the hip.
The patient has little trouble washing and drying in the last 4 weeks because of pain in the hip.
The patient has moderate trouble washing and drying in the last 4 weeks because of pain in the hip.
The patient has extreme difficulty trouble washing and drying in the last 4 weeks because of pain in the hip.
Patient-reported extent to which they are able to access vehicles due to pain in their hip.
The patient found it impossible to get into a vehicle during the past 4 weeks due to pain in hip.
The patient has extreme difficulty at all getting into a vehicle during the past 4 weeks due to pain in hip.
The patient has moderate trouble at all getting into a vehicle during the past 4 weeks due to pain in hip..
The patient has very little trouble at all getting into a vehicle during the past 4 weeks due to pain in hip.
The patient has no trouble at all getting into a vehicle during the past 4 weeks due to pain in hip.
Patient-reported extent to which they experience pain in hip during past 4 weeks when putting on socks, stockings or tights.
Questionnaire wording: Have you been able to put on a pair of socks, stockings or tights?
The patient found it impossible to put on socks, stockings or tights during past 4 weeks because of pain in the shoulder.
The patient had extreme difficulty putting on socks, stockings or tights during past 4 weeks because of pain in the shoulder.
The patient had moderate difficulty putting on socks, stockings or tights during past 4 weeks because of pain in the shoulder.
The patient had little difficulty putting on socks, stockings or tights during the past 4 weeks because of pain in the shoulder.
The patient found it easy to put on socks, stockings or tights during the past 4 weeks because of pain in the shoulder..
Patient-reported extent to which they complete household shopping because of pain in hip in past 4 weeks.
Questionnaire wording: Could you do the household shopping on your own?
The patient found it impossible to complete household shopping because of hip pain all of the time during past 4 weeks.
The patient can complete household shopping with extreme difficulty because of hip pain all of the time during past 4 weeks.
The patient can complete household shopping with moderate difficulty because of hip pain all of the time during past 4 weeks.
The patient can complete household shopping with little difficulty because of hip pain all of the time during past 4 weeks.
The patient can complete household shopping easily because of hip pain all of the time during past 4 weeks.
Patient-reported extent to which they duration they were able to walk due to hip pain in past 4 weeks.
Questionnaire wording: For how long have you been able to walk before pain from your hip becomes severe? (with or without a stick)
Not at all - pain severe on walking
The patient found that they can't walk without pain becoming severe during the past 4 weeks.
The patient found that they could walk around the house only before pain becomes severe during the past 4 weeks.
The patient found that they could walk 5 to 15 minutes before pain becomes severe during the past 4 weeks.
The patient found that they could walk 16 to 30 minutes before pain becomes severe during the past 4 weeks.
The patient found that they could walk with no pain or more than 30 minutes before pain becomes severe during the past 4 weeks.
Patient-reported extent to which they could climb stairs during the past 4 weeks.
Questionnaire wording: Have you been able to climb a flight of stairs?
Patient-reported extent to which they could stand from a chair after a meal during past 4 weeks.
Questionnaire wording: After a meal (sat at a table), how painful has it been for you to stand up from a chair because of your hip?
The patient found it unbearable to stand after a meal due to hip pain over the last 4 weeks.
The patient found it very painful to stand after a meal due to hip pain over the last 4 weeks.
The patient found it moderately painful to stand after a meal due to hip pain over the last 4 weeks.
The patient found it slightly painful to stand after a meal due to hip pain over the last 4 weeks.
The patient found it not at all painful to stand after a meal due to hip pain over the last 4 weeks.
Patient-reported extent to which they were limping when walking because of hip pain during past 4 weeks.
Questionnaire wording: Have you been limping when walking, because of your hip?
The patient has been limping when walking all of the time, because of hip pain during past 4 weeks.
The patient has been limping when walking most of the time, because of hip pain during past 4 weeks.
The patient has been limping when walking often, not just at first, because of hip pain during past 4 weeks.
The patient has been limping when walking sometimes, or just at first, because of hip pain during past 4 weeks.
The patient has been rarely / never been limping when walking, because of hip pain during past 4 weeks.
Patient-reported extent to which experienced sudden severe hip pain during past 4 weeks.
Questionnaire wording: Have you had any sudden, severe pain - 'shooting', 'stabbing' or 'spasms' - from the affected hip?
The patient had severe hip pain every day during past 4 weeks.
The patient had severe hip pain most days during past 4 weeks.
The patient had severe hip pain some days during past 4 weeks.
The patient had severe hip pain only 1 or 2 days during past 4 weeks.
The patient had severe hip pain no days during past 4 weeks.
Patient-reported extent to which hip pain has interfered with work during past 4 weeks.
Questionnaire wording: How much has pain from your hip interfered with your usual work (including housework)?
The patient reports that hip pain has interfered totally with their work in last 4 weeks.
The patient reports that hip pain has interfered greatly with their work in last 4 weeks.
The patient reports that hip pain has interfered moderately with their work in last 4 weeks.
The patient reports that hip pain has interfered a little bit with their work in last 4 weeks.
The patient reports that hip pain has not interfered with their work in last 4 weeks.
Patient-reported extent of pain in hip at night during past 4 weeks.
Questionnaire wording: Have you been troubled by pain from your hip in bed at night?
The patient has experienced hip pain every night in past 4 weeks.
The patient has experienced hip pain most nights in past 4 weeks.
The patient has experienced hip pain some nights in past 4 weeks.
The patient has experienced hip pain only 1 or 2 nights in past 4 weeks.
The patient has experienced hip pain no nights in past 4 weeks.
The patient has experienced severe pain in hip during past 4 weeks.
The patient found it impossible to climb stairs due to hip pain during past 4 weeks.
The patient found it extremely difficult to climb stairs due to hip pain during past 4 weeks.
The patient found it moderately difficult to climb stairs due to hip pain during past 4 weeks.
The patient found it a little difficult to climb stairs due to hip pain during past 4 weeks.
The patient found it they could easily climb stairs due to hip pain during past 4 weeks.
May indicate moderate to severe hip arthritis.
May indicate mild to moderate hip arthritis.
